title: LIVE updates of the Bondi Beach shooting (viewer discretion advised)
description: Two gunmen, identified as father and son, have killed 15 people at Bondi Beach in a horrific Sunday night terror attack that has sent shockwaves through the nation.  Gunfire was reported to police just after 6.40pm on Sunday, sending hundreds fleeing from the beach as officers raced to the scene.  This is a developing story. title: Bondi Beach terror attack kills 16 | 7NEWS
description: Gunmen opened fire on Jewish Hanukkah celebrations at Bondi Beach, killing 16 people including two rabbis, a Holocaust survivor, and injuring over 40 others. Eyewitness Lily Bowman describes the terror as continuous gunshots lasted approximately 10 minutes, causing mass panic as beachgoers fled the scene. The victims include Rabbis Eli Schlanger and Yaakov Levitan, Holocaust survivor Alex Kleytman, congregation member Reuven Morrison, and 27-year-old French national Dan Elkayam. title: English tourist recounts horrifying experience during Bondi shooting | 7NEWS
description: A shooting incident occurred at Bondi Beach during school holidays, leaving the normally crowded iconic location deserted and the community in shock. Two police officers were critically injured and hospitalised in stable condition after gunshots rang out near a Hanukkah-by-the-Sea celebration. Witnesses, including tourists and local Jewish community members, described fleeing for safety when the gunfire erupted at one of Australia's most famous beaches. title: Sydneysiders queue up outside Lifeblood Town Hall to donate blood after Bondi terror attack
description: A huge queue is growing outside Lifeblood Town Hall as Sydneysiders donate blood in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack. O-negative and O-positive blood types are particularly low, with anyone able to give blood urged to book an appointment by calling 13 14 95 or using the Lifeblood app. #bondi #bondibeach #bondishooting #sydney #lifeblood  If you need help in a crisis, call Lifeline on 13 11 14. title: Neighbours shocked by Bondi shooting family killers | 7NEWS
description: Neighbours express shock and fear after discovering they were living next to people involved in a serious incident. Residents describe the family as quiet, withdrawn individuals who kept to themselves and rarely interacted with others in the community. The revelation has left the neighbourhood feeling unsafe and disturbed by the proximity to what they now know was occurring nearby. description: NSW Police have called for calm after Sunday's terror attack at Bondi Beach. title: Bondi Beach terror attack update: What we know so far | 7NEWS
description: A deadly terror attack at Bondi Beach has claimed 15 lives, with victims ranging from 10 to 87 years old, including Holocaust survivor Alex Kleitman and two rabbis. The attack was carried out by a father and son duo - 50-year-old Sajid Akram who was killed by police, and his 24-year-old son Naveed who remains in critical condition under police guard. Syrian-Australian Ahmed Al Ahmed has been hailed as a hero after wrestling a gun from one of the attackers, sustaining gunshot wounds in the process but potentially saving many more lives. title: NSW Premier promises tougher gun laws after shooting | 7NEWS
description: New South Wales Premier announces plans to introduce legislation restricting firearms access following a recent shooting incident involving a licensed gun owner. The proposed changes include making it more difficult to obtain firearms licences and conducting audits of current licence holders to determine ongoing eligibility. Police have also been put on high alert for potential retaliatory violence, with authorities warning of zero tolerance for any vindictive counter-attacks in the community. title: 'A surreal experience': Malcolm Turnbull speaks on Bondi shooting massacre | 7NEWS
description: Former Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull visits Bondi Beach to lay flowers following a terrorist attack that claimed multiple lives. Turnbull discusses the challenges of preventing lone-wolf terrorist attacks despite extensive counterterrorism resources and calls for national unity rather than division. He questions how one of the attackers obtained six licensed firearms in suburban Sydney and suggests gun licensing laws may need review. title: Katie Brown breaks down as she recalls moment gunmen opened fire at Bondi Beach | 7NEWS
description: Sunrise Reporter Katie Brown has broken down on Monday as she recounted the moment gunmen opened fire on Bondi Beach.  Brown saying she was walking along the beach after an evening surf when two men wearing black opened fire from atop a footbridge behind the surf club.  Initially, she thought the gunshots were fireworks. It was the â€œscreams and faces of pure terrorâ€, she said, that made it clear to Brown and her friend what was actually happening.
